notes.text:
Red Hat Multicluster GlobalHub 1.0.2 General
Availability release images, which fix bugs, provide security updates, and update container images.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact
of Critical. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score,
which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability
from the CVE links in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Multicluster GlobalHub 1.0.2 images

This advisory contains the container images for Red Hat Multicluster
GlobalHub, which fix several bugs.

Security fix(es):
CVE-2023-49568 go-git: Maliciously crafted Git server replies can cause DoS on
go-git clients
CVE-2023-49569 go-git: Maliciously crafted Git server replies can lead to path
traversal and RCE on go-git clients
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A denial of service (DoS) vulnerability was found in the go library go-git. This issue may allow an attacker to perform denial of service attacks by providing specially crafted responses from a Git server, which can trigger resource exhaustion in go-git clients.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: go-git: Maliciously crafted Git server replies can cause DoS on go-git clients
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This problem only affects the go implementation and not the original git cli code. Applications using only in-memory filesystems are not affected by this issue. Clients should be limited to connect to only trusted git servers to reduce the risk of compromise.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
See the multicluster global hub product documentation for more information:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_advanced_cluster_management_for_kubernetes/2.9/html-single/multicluster_global_hub/index
In cases where a bump to the latest version of go-git is not possible, a recommendation to reduce the exposure of this threat is limiting its use to only trust-worthy Git servers.

vulnerabilities.title: go-git: Maliciously crafted Git server replies can cause DoS on go-git clients

cwe.name: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

notes.text: A path traversal vulnerability was discovered in the go library go-git. This issue may allow an attacker to create and amend files across the filesystem when applications are using the default ChrootOS, potentially allowing remote code execution.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: go-git: Maliciously crafted Git server replies can lead to path traversal and RCE on go-git clients
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
This problem only affects the go implementation and not the original git cli code. Applications using BoundOS or in-memory filesystems are not affected by this issue. Clients should be limited to connect to only trusted git servers to reduce the risk of compromise.

In OpenShift Container Platform (OCP) the vulnerable github.com/go-git/go-git/v5 Go package is used as a dependency in many components where the vulnerable function is not used, hence the impact by this vulnerability is reduced to Low.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

In cases where a bump to the latest version of go-git is not possible, a recommendation to reduce the exposure of this threat is limiting its use to only trust-worthy Git servers.
